recovery.translation[0].definitions[0].d: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc
recovery.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Doctors expect him to make a full recovery.
Ann made a quick recovery from her operation.
recovery.translation[0].definitions[1].d: the process of returning to a normal condition after a period of trouble or difficulty
recovery.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Hopes of economic recovery are fading.
recovery.translation[0].definitions[2].d: when you get something back that has been taken or lost
recovery.translation[0].definitions[2].e: the recovery of the stolen money
recovery.translation[0].note_box[0].head: – Meaning 1: the process of getting better after an illness, injury etc
recovery.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: She has since made a complete recovery.
She believes that a holiday would speed my recovery.
Although it is not a cure, the drug can aid recovery.
She was severely injured but made a full recovery.
He is making a good recovery from a knee injury.
Doctors have every confidence that Laura will continue her remarkable recovery.
We wish him a speedy recovery.
recovery.translation[0].note_box[1].head: – Meaning 2: the process of returning to a normal condition after a period of trouble or difficulty
recovery.translation[0].note_box[1].sect: The U.S. is showing solid signs of an economic recovery.
Will these policies provide a basis for sustained recovery and sustained growth?
On the foreign exchanges the pound managed a modest recovery from Thursday’s slump.
A slow recovery in the hotel market is likely to hold back the company’s profits.
recovery.translation[1].definitions[0].d: when prices increase or the economy grows again after a difficult period of time
recovery.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Share prices staged a slight recovery yesterday.
Hopes for an economic recovery evaporated.
recovery.translation[1].definitions[1].d: when you get something back, such as money that you are owed
recovery.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The company said it will pursue recovery of its investment.
recovery.translation[1].definitions[2].d: when you gradually get back an amount of money that you have spent on an asset by paying less tax. This reduction in tax is allowed to make up for DEPRECIATION (=the asset’s loss of value over time)
recovery.translation[1].definitions[3].d: anything that an insurance company is able to get back that reduces the total amount of a loss, such as damaged property, stolen goods that are found by the police etc
